[[Lonely Mountain]] | affiliation= | language[[Khuzdul]] | birth={{TA|2450}} | birthlocation= | rule= | death={{TA|2711}} (aged 261) | deathlocation= | age= | notablefor= | house=[[House of Durin]] | parentage=[[Náin II]] | siblings=[[Dáin I]] | spouse= | children=[[Farin]] | gender=Male | height= | hair= | eyes= | clothing= | weapons= | steed= }} '''Borin''' ({{TA|2450}} – {{TA|2711|n}}, aged 261 years) was a [[Dwarves|dwarf]] of [[Durin's folk]]. ==History== Borin was the younger son of [[Kings of Durin's Folk|King]] [[Náin II]]. During his youth, the [[House of Durin]] lived in the [[Dragons|dragon]]-plagued [[Grey Mountains]] that were ruled by his brother [[Dáin I]]. When the King and his son [[Frór]] were slain by a [[Cold-drake]], Durin's folk divided. Borin followed the new King [[Thrór]] back to [[Lonely Mountain]], while others followed [[Grór]] to the [[Iron Hills]]. Borin lived with the [[Dwarves of Erebor]] under [[King under the Mountain|King]] Thrór for the rest of his life. Through his son, [[Farin]], Borin was the ancestor of four of the thirteen Dwarves of [[Thorin and Company]] ([[Balin]], [[Dwalin]], [[Óin]], and [[Glóin]]) and [[Gimli|Gimli Elf-friend]] of the [[Fellowship of the Ring|Company of the Ring]].{{App|Durin}} ==Etymology== [[Jim Allan]] has suggested that ''Borin'' might be derived from [[Old Norse]] ''bora'' ("to bore holes"), thus meaning "Borer".[[Jim Allan]], "Giving of Names", in ''[[An Introduction to Elvish]]'', p. 224 == Genealogy == {{familytree/start}} {{familytree| | | | | | | OIN | | | | | | | | | | | | |OIN=[[Óin (King of Durin's Folk)|Óin]]
